root.name: root
root.message: You step foot in the library. Red velvet drapes cover the windows of this room. An exquisite mahogany desk and matching high-back chair face the entrance and the fireplace, above which hangs a framed picture of a windmill perched atop a rocky crag. Situated in corners of the room are two overstuffed chairs. Floor-to-ceiling bookshelves line the south wall. A rolling wooden ladder allows one to more easily reach the high shelves.

c1a.name: c1a
c1a.message: When you inspect the desk you notice it has an oil lamp, a jar of ink, a quill pen, a tinderbox, and a letter kit containing a red wax candle, four black sheets of parchment, and a wooden seal bearing the insignia of a windmill. None of these items seem like any use to you. You decide to continue your search to the bookshelves.

c1b.name: c1b
c1b.message: The bookshelves hold hundreds of tomes covering a range of topics including history, warfare, and alchemy. There are also several shelves containing first-edition collected works of poetry and fiction. When you take a book off of the shelve it rots and falls apart in your hand. You do however notice something interesting on one of the shelves: a fake book. What do you do?

c2a.name: c2a
c2a.message: When pulling the fake book a secret door opens.

c2b.name: c2b
c2b.message: You read many more titles, none of which seem to be of any help in defeating the monster. You did however find a key. Should you now take the fake book, or return to the hall?

c3.name: c3
c3.message: You enter the secret room. This room contains bookshelves packed with tomes describing different rituals of a cult called the Priests of Osybus. Do they have something to do with this strange house? In the center of the room lies a heavy wooden chest with its lid half-closed. Sticking out of the chest is a skeleton in leather armor.
choices: Read about The Priests of Osybus

c4a.name: c4a
c4a.message: You enter the secret room. This room contains bookshelves packed with tomes describing different rituals of a cult called the Priests of Osybus. Do they have something to do with this strange house? In the center of the room lies a heavy wooden chest with its lid half-closed. Sticking out of the chest is a skeleton in leather armor.
choices: Read about The Priests of Osybus

c5a.name: c5a
c5a.message: You peek inside the chest and find a magical sword. This longsword kills enemies quicker and hurts undead creatures more than regular swords.

c6a.name: c6a
c6a.message: Now that you have the magic sword you feel better equipped to deal with a monster. What do you do next?
choices: Read about The Priests of Osybus

c6b.name: c6b
c6b.message: You feel like this sword might help you a lot, but you decide not from steal from the people living here... even though you really don't feel like many people still come here... How nice of you. What do you do next?

c7a.name: c7a
c7a.message: The Priests of Osybus belong to a centuries old order of magic users that wield necromancy powered by the souls of their victims. But this is so long ago that at this point it is nothing but a fairytale... Right? You feel like you looked through everything the room had to offer. You look at the skeleton again.

c5b.name: c5b

c6c.name: c6c
c6c.message: You take the leather armor of the skeleton, he won't be needing it anymore. You now have leather armor. What do you do next?
choices: Read about The Priests of Osybus

c4c.name: c4c
c4c.message: Seeing the skeleton makes you feel sick. Were Rose and Thorn right? Is there a monster here? And will it kill you too, like it killed this poor adventurer? You decide to leave the secret room before you find out.
